sentences.english: The dog traced a fox to its den.
The canyon walls are lined with giant harpy nests and guano.
sentences.chinese: 峡谷壁上到处是巨大的鸟身人巢穴和鸟粪。

sentences.english: The enormous eagle carried me to its nest in the mountains above the valley.
sentences.chinese: 这只巨鹰把我带到它位于山谷上方山区的巢穴。

sentences.english: Sometimes a coot will try and sneak one of its eggs into a neighbor's nest.
sentences.chinese: 有时白骨顶尝试把自己的蛋偷偷放到相邻巢穴中。

sentences.english: Even though the spy organization/ secret service conceals deeply, I still can nose out their den. 2. What kind of nose do you prefer?
sentences.chinese: 即使特务组织隐藏的很深，我也能找出他们的巢穴。

sentences.english: The tiger retired to its den.
Looked around, jump house board, towards their walk.
sentences.chinese: 望了望四周，跳到屋板上，朝着自己的巢穴走去。

sentences.english: The bigger females tend to hang out and rest nearby.
sentences.chinese: 体型稍大的雌鱼会在离开巢穴在附近休息。

sentences.english: My love of to dight finds no home in the nest deserted by yesterday's love.
sentences.chinese: 于昨日之爱抛弃的巢穴中，我的本日之爱无家可归。

sentences.english: Hunters use dogs to put up birds.
sentences.chinese: 猎人用狗把鸟赶出巢穴。

sentences.english: All animals are smothered in their lairs.
sentences.chinese: 所有的小生灵都躲在巢穴里冬眠。

sentences.english: It's the male garibaldi who makes the nest.
sentences.chinese: 雄性红鱼负责建造巢穴。

sentences.english: They traced the fox to its den.
sentences.chinese: 他们追踪狐狸直抵巢穴。

sentences.english: But because of the facilities inferred from the nest where the Colonel.
sentences.chinese: 但也因此而推断出了施上校的巢穴所在。

sentences.english: More nests of conspirators and saboteurs have been uncovered.
sentences.chinese: 更多阴谋者和破坏者的巢穴被揭发。

sentences.english: All his life he’d lived like a squirrel, moving from one retreat to the next.
sentences.chinese: 他的一生都过得像只松鼠，从一个巢穴搬到另外一个。

definition: lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
